titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: C. W. Hart, Jr. studied crustaceans and worked at the National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of professional papers of C.W. Hart, Jr. Materials include incoming and outgoing correspondence regarding planning for a 1959 trip to Jamaica and 1962 trip to Puerto Rico; a notebook of "shrimp data" from the 1959 Jamaica trip (entries give dates, locations, and brief habitat descriptions); correspondence regarding species identification and exchange of specimens; a small amount of data on water chemistry from Dominica, British West Indies; and a small amount of personal correspondence, a page from a bibliography of works by Hart and others, and a newspaper clipping about the Harts' honeymoon in Puerto Rico.The collection also includes five illustrations in pencil and eleven scanning electron micrographs used in "The Ostradoc family Entocytheridae (Monograph 18, Academy of Natural Sciences, 1974)) by Dabney G. Hart and C.W. Hart, Jr.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
